alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 12:20PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ocean County through 1245 PM EDT... At 1220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cedar Glen Lakes, or 11 miles west of Toms River, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Lakehurst, Cassville, Woodruff, Holiday City-Berkeley, Cedar Glen Lakes, Six Flags Theme Park, Whiting, Cedar Glen West, Pine Ridge At Crestwood, Leisure Village West-Pine Lake Park, Browns Mills, Holiday City South, Leisure Knoll, Crestwood Village, Holiday City, New Egypt and Country Lake Estates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
